data.name: PFunk
data.description: PFunk is an American Brett Beer aged on peaches and nectarines and fermented with Brettanomyces in neutral cognac barrels for added funk.

style.name: Brett Beer
style.description: Brett Beers are any range of color and may take on the color of added fruits or other ingredients. Chill haze, bacteria and yeast-induced haze are allowable at low to medium levels at any temperature. Moderate to intense yet balanced fruity-ester aromas are evident. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like aromas are subtly present. Diacetyl and DMS aromas should not be perceived. Hop aroma is evident over a full range from low to high. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like flavors are subtly present. Fruited versions will exhibit fruit flavors in harmonious balance with other characters. Hop flavor is evident over a full range from low to high. Hop bitterness is evident over a full range from low to high. The evolution of natural acidity develops balanced complexity. Horsey, goaty, leathery, phenolic and light to moderate and/or fruity acidic character evolved from Brettanomyces organisms may be evident, not dominant and in balance with other character. Cultured yeast strains may be used in the fermentation. Beers in this style should not use bacteria or exhibit bacteria-derived characters. Moderate to intense yet balanced fruity-ester flavors are evident. Diacetyl and DMS flavors should not be perceived. Wood vessels may be used during the fermentation and aging process, but wood-derived flavors such as vanillin must not be present. Residual flavors that come from liquids previously aged in a barrel such as bourbon or sherry should not be present. Body is evident over a full range from low to high. For purposes of competition entries exhibiting wood-derived characters or characters of liquids previously aged in wood would more appropriately be entered in other Wood-Aged Beer categories. Wood- and barrel-aged sour ales should not be entered here and are classified elsewhere.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

data.name: Saranac Brett Saison
data.description:
Belgian style Saison fermented with a unique blend of Brettanomyces yeasts and then aged in American rye whiskey barrels. The resulting beer is a mix of fruity and wild, with notes of overripe fruit, black pepper, and spicy whiskey character. 

Original Gravity: 16 Plato
Malts - Pale, Wheat, Vienna
Hops - Amarillo, Opal, Saaz

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

data.name: Session Brett
data.description:
Session Brett is a hazy, straw colored beer, using a pilsner and 2-Row malt blend. This beer was both brewed and dry hopped with 100% Mosaic hops. Session Brett was completely fermented in stainless with our house 
Brettanomyces. The finished beer has an 
aroma bursting with pineapple and notes 
of bread crust. Pineapple continues 
throughout the flavor with additional 
notes of fresh cut grass. A mild tartness 
in the finish is nicely balanced with a 
pleasant hop bitterness

breweries.name: Allagash Brewing Company
breweries.description: Allagash Brewing Company was founded by Rob Tod in 1995 as a one man operation dedicated to hand crafting the best Belgian inspired beers in the world. The first beer brewed was Allagash White, a spiced wheat beer and now our company flagship available in 17 states. We love beer, we love working with each other, we continually push the limits of beer and ourselves, and we grow as a profitable and sustainable company (and as individuals), without compromising our values or purpose. This passion has helped us push Allagash to the forefront of the growing Belgian beer category. We’ve won countless awards for our beer (11 medals including 4 gold since 2002 at The Great American Beer Festival & 10 medals including gold & silver in 2012 since 1998 at the bi-annual World Beer Cup), and received acclaim in the press (Gourmet, Bon Appetit, Men’s Journal, GQ, The Wall Street Journal and Saveur). But perhaps best of all, everyone in the Allagash family loves working here.

breweries.name: Lake Effect Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our name, Lake Effect, is inspired by the weather phenomenon we experience on the Great Lakes, most famous for creating legendary snow storms. The lake effect also produces longer growing seasons that yield some of the highest-quality grains, fruits and vegetables in the world. Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.

data.name: Spectre
data.description: American IPA fermented exclusively with brettanomyces bruxellensis; evocative & etheral blend of brett-induced fruit & funk + hop-driven aromas of white wine, citrus, grass & pine; brewed with nelson sauvin & falconer’s flight hops.

breweries.name: Bluejacket
breweries.description: Brewery and Tavern in SE Washington, DC.

data.name: Super Kitty Fantastico
data.description:
Help us celebrate our first anniversary with a special release of Super Kitty Fantastico 2015! We
brewed this one at Outliers using the medal-winning recipe developed by our sister brewery, Brugge.
With an ABV at 10%, Super Kitty Fantastico is a barrel-aged Tripel with Brettanomyces Fantasticus
and Lactobacillus, which are technical terms for crazy delicious.

In 2011, Super Kitty Fantastico was awarded the bronze medal for American Style Brett Ales at the
prestigious Great American Beer Festival. Plus, she’s an adorable kitty with roller skates and shades.

breweries.name: Brugge Brasserie
breweries.description:
Located in Indianapolis’ Broad Ripple Neighborhood, Brugge Brasserie specializes in award-winning handcrafted ales and classic Belgian brasserie fair.

The landscape of Belgian beer includes a dizzying array of styles. Each of them offers the drinker something extremely special. Our selection of handcrafted beers looks to honor the Belgian tradition while keeping a firm grasp on our Indiana roots.

breweries.name: Creature Comforts Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Creature Comforts was founded by people passionate for starting a craft brewery in Athens, GA, a town that we love and that has the potential to be a craft beer hub and destination for the South East.  The first piece of the puzzle was David Stein who at the time was the head brewer at Twain's Billiards & Tap, a well-known brewpub in Decatur, GA.   David was a home brewer turned pro, whose passion for craft beer had moved him through working at some of the top craft beer establishments.  David was using the name Creature Comforts for his personal home brews and that name became the foundation for the brewery we run today.  David quickly brought on his friend Adam Beauchamp, who was in his seventh year of brewing beer at Sweetwater Brewing Company in Atlanta, GA, a brewery he began working at after leaving a PHD in Genetics program at Emory.  Adam himself was an accomplished home-brewer and he had a wealth of experience running a production brewery.                   

With the help of a craft beer enthusiast and local Athens, GA businessman, Derek Imes, we began building Creature Comforts in a beautiful 13,000 square foot historic warehouse building in downtown Athens.  The building was originally built in the 1940's as a Chevy dealership and later became Snow Tire Co., before Creature Comforts took over.  Building in a 1940's warehouse presented a lot of challenges as well as many wonderful opportunities.  One such opportunity was the chance to salvage and reclaim the old wood from the building that was subsequently refinished and then put back into the brewery in the form of bar tops, tables, wall paneling, and ceilings.  The final result, is a brewery that has won an award for outstanding rehabilitation by the Athens Heritage Foundation and something that we are extremely proud to share with the world.

Approximately two months before opening, we found the final missing piece.  We knew we wanted to bring someone into the family who would handle the business aspects of the brewery, considering the fact that Adam and David are brewers dedicated to spending every minute of their day making the best possible beer.  Through a long journey that ended with a very serendipitous introduction that came via a person in Vancouver, British Columbia, Chris Herron, a Georgia native himself who was living in Connecticut, became the CEO of Creature Comforts.  Chris had spent 12 years working in sales, pricing, and finance for major beverage alcohol suppliers, and was intent on starting a craft brewery in Georgia, which made him joining Creature Comforts an easy choice.   We have since added, Blake Tyers a veteran and forward thinking home brewer as a brewer at Creature Comforts, and we brought on Katie Beauchamp to manage our office activities, tours and special events.  Combined with the nearly 20 part time tour staff we have, our entire family is together and we have  20+ years of experience.

What started out as curious exploration of what we love, turned into us uncovering our passion, following that passion, and finding happiness, which has allowed us to enjoy the Creature Comforts of life.   Creature Comforts Brewing Company is truly our very own creature comfort.  Our brewery is what makes us happy, it is what makes us feel at home, it is what comforts us, and puts us in a happy place.  Creature Comforts is the end result of the story of our past and the starting point for the story our future, and we look forward to writing that story with you.

We have a rotating kitchen residency where we bring in our favorite restaurants to take over our kitchen for a few weeks at a time.

data.name: Trip XX
data.description: This was a fun beer to brew, partly because there were a lot of people on hand, including Peter and Dick, who collaborated on this last Trip idea, and Chris Murakami, who did most of the work. We began with a simple enough malt bill of pale and C-77 crystal, bumped the gravity and lightened the body with some sugar, adding Magnum hops to bitter and Styrian Goldings to finish, with some French Strisselspalt for dry hopping. Then the x-factor, brettanomyces, was added in the bright tank immediately before kegging, and the kegs were warm conditioned for more than a month.

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

data.name: Turtle Gut
data.description: Subtle earthy funk, malty sweetness and sharp acidity combine to give Turtle Gut its distinctive profile. Achieved with a mixed fermentation of Brettanomyces, Lactobacillus, and Saccharomces, our first aged sourrelease aims to please seasoned sour beer drinkers as well as the curious beer drinker who doesn't yet know they're a sour beer fan.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Cape May Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are Cape May County's first and only microbrewery serving South Jersey. Our beers are made in small batches and are hand crafted with the finest ingredients. We are just a small team, in a small warehouse, who share the same vision to make the finest quality beer possible.

data.name: Uno Bretto
data.description: 100% Brettanomyces lambicus fermented golden ale. American and European specialty malts and hops. Fresh pineapple, cantaloupe, subtle funk earthiness.

breweries.name: Wander Brewing
breweries.description: Wander Brewing is a production craft brewery located in Bellingham, WA. Wander was created to produce both traditional and innovative ales and lagers while maintaining our commitment to sustainable practices in our community.

data.name: Untamed
data.description: 100% Brettanomyces Ale - 6% ABV.  An untraditional ale fermented with wild yeast.  Traditional farmhouse format.  Amber, malty, fruity and different

breweries.name: Falling Branch Brewery
breweries.description: With an emphasis on the origin of the “Farmhouse Ale,” Falling Branch Brewery has formulated several beers hearkening back to rural Belgium, while incorporating ingredients and brewing techniques that are uniquely American. With a myriad of cheese and beer choices, everyone will find a pairing to love from Falling Branch Brewery.

data.name: Urine Trouble
data.description: Brewed with our friends at Surly, this Imperial Brett IPA is fermented with a unique strain of yeast, Brettanomyces Lambicus. This yeast creates earthy barnyard notes along with pineapple and cherry pie aromas. Of course, it’s hopped heavily. Simcoe and Chinook are the culprits for the “cat peed on the Christmas tree” aroma.

breweries.name: Surly Brewing Company
breweries.description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

breweries.name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.

In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

breweries.name: O'so Brewing
breweries.description:
The O'so Brewing Company, 1812 Post Road, Plover, is ready to offer local residents a taste of the unusual as they begin to brew their first batch of beer.

The company, founded by Marc Buttera and Bart Peterson, has one goal: brew beer differently. "I don't think anyone around here offers what I'm looking at ... we want to fill some voids,I don't want to make a regular brown ale, or pale ale. I want to do something that fits in between."

The dream for Buttera started when he was in college, and a friend turned him on to home brewing, which he has been doing now for about 13 years. Four years ago, his love of home brewing led him to open the Point Brew Supply, 1816 Post Road, Plover, with his wife, Katina.

"It (Point Brew Supply) has opened my eyes to all the different ingredients that I think a lot of brewers don't have exposure to," "I've played with every single strain of yeast and grain and hop in there.

O'so Brewing Co. is planning to have a varied lineup of beers, with interesting names and flavors. They will have a red ale, a West Coast Pale Ale showcasing American hops, as well as a Black Cocker Bock.

"I'm ready to show the world what I've learned, and I'm definitely not going to do things like other people are, but I think I'm on some sort of weird cutting edge.

The brewery has a capacity to brew about 280 gallons per batch, with plans to brew twice a week. A unique aspect of their marketing technique will be in the tapper. The design, a "Big O" will be the brewery's signature.

locations.name: Main Brewery

Monday -Saturday 9:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.
Sunday 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.

data.name: Wild Streak
data.description:
There was a time when all beers were aged in wood, and yeasts ran wild and cavorted together. Modern brewing is wonderful, of course, but sometimes a little cavorting is a fine thing. Sometimes it gives you a chance to reveal your funky side. We have to admit it - we’ve been cavorting for years...and sorta holding out on you. We didn’t want to do that, but the fact is that up until now we only had enough room to make this beer for ourselves and some close friends - we didn’t have enough beer to put it out on shelves. We actually make a lot of beers like this - we call them the “Ghost Bottles”, and we’ve enjoyed pouring them for you at tastings and dinners.

Now we’re very pleased to finally give one of our “ghosts” the opportunity to materialize in your hands. Brooklyn Wild Streak starts off as a Belgian-inspired golden ale. After fermentation and a brief conditioning, we then age the beer for several months in second-use bourbon barrels, giving it a soft, round character infused with nicely balanced oak flavors. Finally we bottle the beer flat and re-ferment it with blend of priming sugar, Champagne yeast and the wild yeast strain Brettanomyces. As the two yeasts do their cavorting, the beer gains its natural carbonation. The “Brett” takes many months to do its thing during bottle aging, but once it does, Wild Streak is enlivened by a wonderfully complex earthy funk.

This beer is almost one year old when released, but it will age beautifully for many more. It’s particularly great with washed rind cheeses, game meats, steaks, and a few more things we probably shouldn’t mention here. You’ll figure it out for yourself, and that’s half the fun. So go ahead - unwind that cage, pop that cork, and reveal your Wild Streak. You know you want to.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

breweries.name: New Glory Craft Brewery
breweries.description:
New Glory is a small brewery located in Sacramento, CA.   Our name was inspired by the American spirit which embodies ingenuity, hard work, passion, family, pride and a dream.

Our Ales reflect our rich heritage and are brewed with an American twist.  We Commit ourselves to quality, Integrity and Sustainability.

breweries.name: Breakside Brewery
breweries.description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.
